item.title: Who'll reign in Spain?
item.description:
Who'll reign in Spain?

Mobile World Congress in Barcelona is the world's biggest trade show devoted exclusively to mobile tech and this year Geekbeard will be there!

item.title: Lost in cyberspace
item.description:
Lost in cyberspace

Be suspicious of unsolicited emails

Pop quiz time. Who was the first African in space?

item.title: INFOGRAPHIC: How 30% of mobile data is wasted
item.description:
INFOGRAPHIC: How 30% of mobile data is wasted

Web browser maker Opera has released a study that details how much of your mobile data could be eaten by the background activity of some apps.

item.title: A Blade Runner 2 release date has finally been announced
item.description:
A Blade Runner 2 release date has finally been announced

This is not a drill: Blade Runner 2 finally has a release date. Warner Bros. has scheduled the long-awaited sequel to the 1982 Ridley Scott-helmed cult hit for a January 2018 opening, reports THR. Harrison Ford will return to star in the follow-up film, joined by Ryan Gosling.

item.title: By George, Han DID shoot first
item.description:
By George, Han DID shoot first

If there's still anyone you know who believes the alien thug Greedo fired first in the original (subsequently sanatised) version of the cantina scene of Star Wars Episode IV, point them to this recently surfaced version of the movie.

item.title: Telkom: What customer care? - a follow-up
item.description:
Telkom: What customer care? - a follow-up

A few weeks back in my column in the Sunday Tribune I reported on how longstanding frustrations over Telkom's poor customer care had culminated in an online petition aimed at getting the communications parastatal to sort out the mess once and for all.

item.title: The ever growing Internet of things able to spy on you
item.description:
The ever growing Internet of things able to spy on you

Mobile World Congress at Barcelona is just around the corner and, judging by the programme, the Internet of things (IoT) is going to be a major theme.

item.title: My new corner of the web
item.description:
My new corner of the web

After several years of posting annotated versions of my Sunday Tribune and IOL articles as well as miscellaneous tech musings to Tumblr, I've switched to The Grid, an AI-based web-builder.

item.title: The Uber for entrepreneurs
item.description:
The Uber for entrepreneurs

With so much doom and gloom doing the rounds these days, this news comes as a real tonic.

item.title: What the llama saw
item.description:
What the llama saw

As the world's tech journalists champ at the bit to get their hands on Samsung's new Galaxy S7 at it's official unveiling on Sunday, it seems they've been beaten to the punch - and by a Llama, nogal.
